name: davos
description: [{{ project_name|capitalize }}]({{ project_url }}) is an FTP automation tool that periodically scans given host locations for new files. It can be configured for various purposes, including listening for specific files to appear in the host location, ready for it to download and then move, if required. It also supports completion notifications as well as downstream API calls, to further the workflow.

volumes.description: davos's config location. This is where it stores its database file and logs.

ports.description: This is the default port that davos runs under

readme-vars.project_blurb: [{{ project_name|capitalize }}]({{ project_url }}) is an FTP automation tool that periodically scans given host locations for new files. It can be configured for various purposes, including listening for specific files to appear in the host location, ready for it to download and then move, if required. It also supports completion notifications as well as downstream API calls, to further the workflow.

param_volumes.desc: davos's config location. This is where it stores its database file and logs.

readme-vars.app_setup_block: The application does not require any set up other than starting the docker container. Further documentation can be found on the [davos GitHub repository page](https://github.com/linuxserver/davos).

changelogs.desc: Switching to new Base images, shift to arm32v7 tag.
Updating runtime deps due to change in OpenJRE.
Updating build environment to pass proper build flags and use gradle wrapper.

setup: The application does not require any set up other than starting the docker container. Further documentation can be found on the [davos GitHub repository page](https://github.com/linuxserver/davos).
